metadata.title: CVE-2014-7828 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
FreeIPA 4.0.x before 4.0.5 and 4.1.x before 4.1.1, when 2FA is enabled,allows remote attackers to bypass the password requirement of thetwo-factor authentication leveraging an enabled OTP token, which triggersan anonymous bind.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7828` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeipa-admintools - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-client - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-common - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-server - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-server-dns - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-server-trust-ad - 4.0.5-1
freeipa-tests - 4.0.5-1
python-ipaclient - 4.0.5-1
python-ipalib - 4.0.5-1
python-ipaserver - 4.0.5-1
python-ipatests - 4.0.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeipa package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.5-1').
